body: You can use your DI container for that, or try a PR.

issue.title: The specified type member 'Mode' is not supported in LINQ to Entities. Only initializers, entity members, and entity navigation properties are supported
issue.body:
<!-- For feature requests, just clear out the below -->
I AM GETTING ISSUE IN **GetLoanContactsByLoanGuid** method in for loop as mentioned below and **Mode** is a enum which is declared in side  the class BaseEntity

Error:"The specified type member 'Mode' is not supported in LINQ to Entities. Only initializers, entity members, and entity navigation properties are supported"

### Source/destination types

```csharp
public class BaseEntity 
    {
        public virtual bool IsUpdateAllowed { get { return true; } }

        public KumoModelMode Mode { get; set; }

 public enum KumoModelMode
        {
            modeNone = 0,
            modeAdded = 1,
            modeDeleted = 2,
            modeUpdated = 3
        }
}

 public partial class Person : BaseEntity
    {
       
        [Key]
        public long PKPersonID { get; set; }

        public long? FKContactTypeID { get; set; }

        [Required]
        [StringLength(50)]
        public string FirstName { get; set; }

        [Required]
        [StringLength(50)]
        public string LastName { get; set; }

        [StringLength(50)]
        public string MiddleName { get; set; }
}


 public class RelatedPersonDTO:BaseEntity
    {
        public long PKPersonID { get; set; }

        public long FKContactTypeID { get; set; }
        public string FirstName { get; set; }
        public string LastName { get; set; }

    }

 public IQueryable<IBusinessObject<LoanContactDTO>> GetLoanContactsByLoanGuid(Guid loanGuid)
        {
            var allLoanContacts = _loanQuery.GetLoanContactsByLoanGuid(loanGuid);
            var loanContacts = new List<LoanContactBO>();
            if (allLoanContacts != null)
            {
                foreach (var item in allLoanContacts)
                {
                    loanContacts.Add(new LoanContactBO() { LoanContactDTO = item });
                }
                return loanContacts.AsQueryable();
            }
            else
                return null;

            
        }
        public IQueryable<IEntity> GetLoanContactsByLoanGuid(Guid loanGuid)
        {
           return GetLoanContactsByLoanGuidFromDBContext(loanGuid);
            }
private IQueryable<IEntity> GetLoanContactsByLoanGuidFromDBContext(Guid loanGuid)
        {
            try
            {
                var dbContext = _dbFactory.GetDBContext();
                long loanId = dbContext.Loans.Where(x => x.LoanGUID == loanGuid).Select(c => c.PKLoanID).SingleOrDefault();
                
                return dbContext.LoansPersonsCompanies.Where(x => x.FKLoanID == loanId).ProjectTo<LoanContactDTO>(_lmsDtoMapper.Mapper.ConfigurationProvider);
            }
            catch(Exception ex)
            { throw ex; }
        }
### Mapping configuration


 internal class LMSDTOMappingProfile : Profile
    {
        internal LMSDTOMappingProfile()
        {
             CreateMap<LoansPersonsCompany, LoanContactDTO>()                    
                    .ForMember(dto => dto.CreatedByUser, conf => conf.MapFrom(ol => ol.UserCreated))
                   .ForMember(dto => dto.UpdatedByUser, conf => conf.MapFrom(ol => ol.UserUpdated))
                   .ForMember(dto => dto.Mode, conf => conf.Ignore());
     }
}
```

### Version: x.y.z
6.0.2

### Expected behavior

<!-- What did you expect to happen? Or what used to happen in an older version? -->

### Actual behavior

<!-- What happened instead? -->

### Steps to reproduce

```csharp
// Your calls to Mapper.Map or ProjectTo here, with source/destination objects constructed
```

body:
I would like to submit a PR for this issue, but I can't find the project on the Contributor License Agreement site.

disclaimer: this is the first time contributing to an open source project.
You don't have to do anything at the moment. Just a PR.

issue.title: AddProfiles() includes internal types when scanning assemblies
issue.body:
- added tests for scanning internal profiles
 - determine the loading strategy based on "ScanForInternalProfiles" property
 - modified the current implementation so that the scanning is done later in the process, and not immediately (more user friendly)

Fixes #2063.
